meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes money.
meanings.sent1: My uncle is a moneymaker who always finds ways to earn extra cash.
meanings.sent2: The new movie turned out to be a moneymaker at the box office.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel became a moneymaker by collecting nuts and selling them to other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her online store became a moneymaker overnight, bringing in profits beyond her expectations.
meanings.sent5: The young entrepreneur's lemonade stand was a little moneymaker, attracting customers from all around the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: Investing in real estate can be a moneymaker if done wisely.
meanings.sent2: The bakery she started became a moneymaker within the first year.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pet grooming service turned out to be a moneymaker for the young entrepreneur.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to buy stocks in that company proved to be a moneymaker in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The small family restaurant became a local moneymaker, drawing in customers with its delicious food.

meanings.definition: A source of income or revenue.
meanings.sent1: For many artists, selling their paintings is a moneymaker.
meanings.sent2: The rental property became a reliable moneymaker for the landlord.
meanings.sent3: The old car he fixed up became a surprising moneymaker when he sold it for a high price.
meanings.sent4: Her blog became a moneymaker through sponsored posts and advertisements.
meanings.sent5: The farmer's market was a moneymaker for local growers, bringing in steady income every weekend.
